name: google_maps
description: Integrate Google Maps to access location data, geocoding, directions, and mapping services in your application.

tools.name: GOOGLE_MAPS_COMPUTE_ROUTE_MATRIX
tools.description: Calculates travel distance and duration matrix between multiple origins and destinations using the modern Routes API; supports OAuth2 authentication and various travel modes.

inputSchema.title: ComputeRouteMatrixRequest

units.title: Units
units.description: Unit system (e.g., 'METRIC' for kilometers, 'IMPERIAL' for miles) for displaying distances.

items.title: RouteMatrixOriginDestination

address.title: Address
address.description: Address as a string. Provide either address or latitude/longitude.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Latitude in decimal degrees. Must be used with longitude.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: Longitude in decimal degrees. Must be used with latitude.

items.description: A single origin or destination location for the route matrix.

origins.title: Origins
origins.description: List of origin locations. Each can be specified as an address or latitude/longitude coordinates.

fieldMask.title: Field Mask
fieldMask.description: Comma-separated list of response fields to include (e.g., 'originIndex,destinationIndex,duration,distanceMeters'). Use '*' for all fields.

travelMode.title: Travel Mode
travelMode.description: Mode of transportation for the route matrix calculation.

items.title: RouteMatrixOriginDestination

address.title: Address
address.description: Address as a string. Provide either address or latitude/longitude.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Latitude in decimal degrees. Must be used with longitude.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: Longitude in decimal degrees. Must be used with latitude.

items.description: A single origin or destination location for the route matrix.

destinations.title: Destinations
destinations.description: List of destination locations. Each can be specified as an address or latitude/longitude coordinates.

languageCode.title: Language Code
languageCode.description: BCP-47 language code (e.g., 'en-US', 'es') for textual information.

routingPreference.title: Routing Preference
routingPreference.description: Specifies routing preference: `TRAFFIC_UNAWARE` (fastest, ignores traffic), `TRAFFIC_AWARE` (considers traffic, optimized), `TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL` (most accurate traffic-based routing), or `ROUTING_PREFERENCE_UNSPECIFIED` (behavior similar to `TRAFFIC_UNAWARE`).

inputSchema.description: Parameters for computing a route matrix between multiple origins and destinations.

tools.name: GOOGLE_MAPS_DISTANCE_MATRIX_API
tools.description: DEPRECATED: Legacy API that calculates travel distance and time for a matrix of origins and destinations. This API only works with API keys (no OAuth2 support). Use the modern 'Compute Route Matrix' action instead, which supports OAuth2 authentication. Supports different modes of transportation and options like departure/arrival times.

key.title: Key
key.description: Your application's API key. This key identifies your application for purposes of quota management.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Specifies the mode of transport to use.

avoid.title: Avoid
avoid.description: Indicates that the calculated route should avoid the specified features. Multiple values can be pipe-separated e.g. 'tolls|highways'.

units.title: Units
units.description: Specifies the unit system to use when displaying results. The default is metric.

region.title: Region
region.description: The region code, specified as a ccTLD ('top-level domain') two-character value. This helps influence results based on the region.

origins.title: Origins
origins.description: The starting point for calculating travel distance and time. You can supply one or more locations separated by the pipe character (|), in the form of a place ID (prefixed with place_id:), an address, latitude/longitude coordinates (e.g., '40.7128,-74.0060'), a plus code, or an encoded polyline (prefixed with enc: and a colon).

language.title: Language
language.description: The language in which to return results. See the list of supported languages: https://developers.google.com/maps/faq#languagesupport

arrival_time.title: Arrival Time
arrival_time.description: Specifies the desired time of arrival for transit directions, in seconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC. You can specify either departure_time or arrival_time, but not both.

destinations.title: Destinations
destinations.description: One or more locations to use as the finishing point for calculating travel distance and time. Accepts the same formats as origins.

transit_mode.title: Transit Mode
transit_mode.description: Specifies one or more preferred modes of transit. This parameter may only be specified for transit directions. Multiple values can be pipe-separated e.g. 'bus|train'.

traffic_model.title: Traffic Model
traffic_model.description: Specifies the assumptions to use when calculating time in traffic. This parameter is only used if the request includes a departure_time and mode is 'driving'.

departure_time.title: Departure Time
departure_time.description: Specifies the desired time of departure. You can specify the time as an integer in seconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC, or as the string 'now'. Required for duration_in_traffic.

transit_routing_preference.title: Transit Routing Preference
transit_routing_preference.description: Specifies preferences for transit routes. This parameter may only be specified for transit directions.

tools.name: GOOGLE_MAPS_GEOCODING_API
tools.description: DEPRECATED: Legacy API to convert addresses into geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) and vice versa (reverse geocoding), or get an address for a Place ID. This API only works with API keys (no OAuth2 support). Consider using the modern Places API (Text Search or Nearby Search) for similar functionality with OAuth2 authentication.

key.title: Key
key.description: Your application's API key. If not provided, will be extracted from connection metadata.

bounds.title: Bounds
bounds.description: The bounding box of the viewport within which to bias geocode results more prominently (e.g., '34.172684,-118.604794|34.236144,-118.500938'). This parameter will only influence, not fully restrict, results.

latlng.title: Latlng
latlng.description: The latitude and longitude coordinates specifying the location for which you want the closest, human-readable address (e.g., '40.714224,-73.961452'). Provide for reverse geocoding.

region.title: Region
region.description: The region code, specified as a ccTLD ('top-level domain') two-character value. This parameter will only influence, not fully restrict, results from the geocoder.

address.title: Address
address.description: The street address or plus code that you want to geocode. Provide for geocoding (address to coordinates).

language.title: Language
language.description: The language in which to return results. If language is not supplied, the geocoder attempts to use the preferred language as specified in the Accept-Language header, or the native language of the domain from which the request is sent.

place_id.title: Place Id
place_id.description: The place ID of the place for which you wish to obtain the human-readable address. Provide for place ID geocoding.

components.title: Components
components.description: A components filter with elements separated by a pipe (|). E.g., 'postal_code:94043|country:US'. Used for geocoding, can be restrictive or biasing.

result_type.title: Result Type
result_type.description: A filter of one or more address types, separated by a pipe (|) (e.g., 'street_address|locality'). Used for reverse geocoding and place ID geocoding.

location_type.title: Location Type
location_type.description: A filter of one or more location types, separated by a pipe (|) (e.g., 'ROOFTOP|RANGE_INTERPOLATED'). Used for reverse geocoding and place ID geocoding.

extra_computations.title: Extra Computations
extra_computations.description: Use this parameter to specify additional features in the response. Can select multiple values.

tools.name: GOOGLE_MAPS_GET_DIRECTION
tools.description: DEPRECATED: Legacy API that fetches detailed directions between an origin and a destination, supporting intermediate waypoints and various travel modes. This API only works with API keys (no OAuth2 support). Use the modern 'Get Route' action instead, which supports OAuth2 authentication.

inputSchema.title: GetDirectionRequest

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: The mode of transportation for which to calculate directions. Supported values are 'driving' (default), 'walking', 'bicycling', and 'transit'.

avoid.title: Avoid
avoid.description: Specifies features to avoid in the generated route. Multiple values can be combined using a pipe delimiter (e.g., 'tolls|highways'). Valid options include 'tolls', 'highways', and 'ferries'.

units.title: Units
units.description: The unit system for displaying distances. Supported values are 'metric' (kilometers and meters) and 'imperial' (miles and feet). Defaults to 'imperial'.

origin.title: Origin
origin.description: The starting point for the directions. This can be a textual address (e.g., '123 Main St, Los Angeles, CA'), a place name (e.g., 'Disneyland'), or latitude/longitude coordinates (e.g., '34.0522,-118.2437').

language.title: Language
language.description: The language code for returning results, e.g., 'en' for English, 'es' for Spanish. Defaults to 'en'.

waypoints.title: Waypoints
waypoints.description: A comma-separated string of intermediate locations (addresses, place names, or coordinates) to visit between the origin and destination.

destination.title: Destination
destination.description: The ending point for the directions. This can be a textual address (e.g., '456 Park Ave, New York, NY'), a place name (e.g., 'Universal Studios Hollywood'), or latitude/longitude coordinates (e.g., '40.7128,-74.0060').

inputSchema.description: Parameters for requesting directions between specified locations.

tools.name: GOOGLE_MAPS_GET_ROUTE
tools.description: Calculates one or more routes between two specified locations. Uses various travel modes and preferences; addresses must be resolvable by Google Maps.

inputSchema.title: GetRouteRequest

units.title: Units
units.description: Unit system (e.g., 'METRIC' for kilometers, 'IMPERIAL' for miles) for displaying distances.

fieldMask.title: Field Mask
fieldMask.description: Comma-separated list of `Route` object fields to include in the response (e.g., 'routes.distanceMeters,routes.duration') for efficiency.

travelMode.title: Travel Mode
travelMode.description: Mode of transportation for the route.

languageCode.title: Language Code
languageCode.description: BCP-47 language code (e.g., 'en-US', 'es') for textual information like navigation instructions.

origin_address.title: Origin Address
origin_address.description: Starting point address or place name for the route calculation.

routingPreference.title: Routing Preference
routingPreference.description: Specifies routing preference: `TRAFFIC_UNAWARE` (fastest, ignores traffic), `TRAFFIC_AWARE` (considers traffic, optimized), `TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL` (most accurate traffic-based routing), or `ROUTING_PREFERENCE_UNSPECIFIED` (behavior similar to `TRAFFIC_UNAWARE`). Cannot be set when travelMode is WALK, BICYCLE, or TRANSIT - must be omitted for these modes.

destination_address.title: Destination Address
destination_address.description: Destination point address or place name for the route calculation.

computeAlternativeRoutes.title: Compute Alternative Routes
computeAlternativeRoutes.description: Computes and returns alternative routes if true.

routeModifiers_avoidTolls.title: Route Modifiers Avoid Tolls
routeModifiers_avoidTolls.description: Attempts to avoid toll roads if true.

routeModifiers_avoidFerries.title: Route Modifiers Avoid Ferries
routeModifiers_avoidFerries.description: Attempts to avoid ferries if true.

routeModifiers_avoidHighways.title: Route Modifiers Avoid Highways
routeModifiers_avoidHighways.description: Attempts to avoid highways if true.

inputSchema.description: Parameters for requesting a route, including origin, destination, travel mode, and preferences.

tools.name: GOOGLE_MAPS_MAPS_EMBED_API
tools.description: Tool to generate an embeddable Google Map URL and HTML iframe code. Use when you need to display a map (place, view, directions, street view, search) on a webpage without JavaScript. Note: This API only works with API keys (no OAuth2 support). It generates embed URLs and does not make direct API calls.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: The mode of the embedded map.

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840'). This is REQUIRED for view mode.

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

q.title: Q
q.description: Defines the map marker location. Accepts a URL-escaped place name, address, plus code, or Place ID (prefixed with 'place_id:').

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840').

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

q.title: Q
q.description: Defines the search term. Can include a geographic restriction (e.g., 'record+stores+in+Seattle').

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840').

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

avoid.title: Avoid
avoid.description: Specifies features to avoid in directions (e.g., 'tolls', 'highways', 'ferries'). Separate multiple values with the pipe character (|). E.g. 'tolls|highways'.

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840').

origin.title: Origin
origin.description: Defines the starting point for directions. Accepts URL-escaped place name, address, plus code, lat/lng coordinates, or Place ID (prefixed with 'place_id:').

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

waypoints.title: Waypoints
waypoints.description: Specifies one or more intermediary places to route directions. Separate multiple waypoints with the pipe character (|). E.g., 'Berlin,Germany|Paris,France'. Up to 20 waypoints.

destination.title: Destination
destination.description: Defines the endpoint of the directions. Accepts URL-escaped place name, address, plus code, lat/lng coordinates, or Place ID (prefixed with 'place_id:').

fov.title: Fov
fov.description: Horizontal field of view in degrees (10-100). Smaller numbers mean higher zoom.

pano.title: Pano
pano.description: A specific panorama ID. Required if 'location' is not provided. 'location' can be a fallback.

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

pitch.title: Pitch
pitch.description: Angle, up or down, of the camera in degrees (-90 to 90). Positive is up.

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840').

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: Radius in meters to search for a panorama, centered on lat/lng. Default 50.

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

source.title: Source
source.description: Limits Street View searches to selected sources. 'default' or 'outdoor'.

heading.title: Heading
heading.description: Compass heading of the camera in degrees clockwise from North (-180 to 360).

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

location.title: Location
location.description: Latitude and longitude as comma-separated values (e.g., '46.414382,10.013988'). Displays panorama closest to this location. Required if 'pano' is not provided.

tools.name: GOOGLE_MAPS_NEARBY_SEARCH
tools.description: Searches for places (e.g., restaurants, parks) within a specified circular area, with options to filter by place types and customize the returned fields and number of results.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: Radius of the circular search area in meters.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Latitude coordinate of the search center in decimal degrees.

fieldMask.title: Field Mask
fieldMask.description: Comma-separated list of place fields for the response (e.g., 'places.displayName,places.formattedAddress'); use '*' for all fields.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: Longitude coordinate of the search center in decimal degrees.

excludedTypes.title: Excluded Types
excludedTypes.description: Place types to exclude (e.g., 'cafe', 'store'); results matching any of these types are omitted. For supported types, see Google Maps Places API documentation.

includedTypes.title: Included Types
includedTypes.description: Place types to include (e.g., 'restaurant', 'park'); results will match at least one of these types. For supported types, see Google Maps Places API documentation.

maxResultCount.title: Max Result Count
maxResultCount.description: Maximum number of search results to return (up to 20); the actual count may be lower.

tools.name: GOOGLE_MAPS_TEXT_SEARCH
tools.description: Searches for places on Google Maps using a textual query (e.g., "restaurants in London", "Eiffel Tower").

fieldMask.title: Field Mask
fieldMask.description: Comma-separated list of place fields to return. Use `*` for all fields (not recommended for performance/cost). See Google Maps Places API documentation for field names.

textQuery.title: Text Query
textQuery.description: Text query for searching places. Matched against place name, address, and category.

maxResultCount.title: Max Result Count
maxResultCount.description: Maximum number of place results to return (must be 1-20). Note: Google prefers `pageSize`, but this action uses `maxResultCount`.
